remarks: A version of ~ climmul using bound-variable hypotheses instead of distinct variable conditions.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 29-Jun-2017.)
statement:
climmulf.1 $e |- F/ k ph $.
climmulf.2 $e |- F/_ k F $.
climmulf.3 $e |- F/_ k G $.
climmulf.4 $e |- F/_ k H $.
climmulf.5 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
climmulf.6 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
climmulf.7 $e |- ( ph -> F ~~> A ) $.
climmulf.8 $e |- ( ph -> H e. X ) $.
climmulf.9 $e |- ( ph -> G ~~> B ) $.
climmulf.10 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) e. CC ) $.
climmulf.11 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( G ` k ) e. CC ) $.
climmulf.12 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( H ` k ) = ( ( F ` k ) x. ( G ` k ) ) ) $.
climmulf $p |- ( ph -> H ~~> ( A x. B ) ) $.
$d Z k $.
